What a fascinating choice! Based on your interest in war stories, I think you might enjoy "Cold Mountain". It's a powerful and emotional journey about a wounded soldier's quest to return home, set against the backdrop of the American Civil War. With an all-star cast, including Renée Zellweger and Jude Law, this film is sure to captivate you.

If you're in the mood for something a bit different, I'd also recommend "Taxi Driver". While it's not strictly a war movie, it does deal with themes of isolation and conflict, set against the gritty backdrop of 1970s New York City. With Robert De Niro delivering a iconic performance as Travis Bickle, this film is a must-see for anyone who loves character-driven drama.

I think I have just the movie for you! Based on your interest in Jonathan Liebesman's work and the war genre, I highly recommend "Flags of Our Fathers" (2006). This film is a powerful and emotional portrayal of the six men who raised the flag at the Battle of Iwo Jima during World War II. Directed by Clint Eastwood, it features an all-star cast, including Ryan Phillippe, Adam Garcia, and Jesse Bradford.

If you're interested in something with a similar historical backdrop but with a more unique story, "Red Cliff" (2008) could be the way to go! This epic Chinese film is based on a famous battle from China's Three Kingdoms period and features stunning action sequences and beautiful cinematography.
